intro: Palicourea winkleri, commonly known as the pink-flowered palicourea, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. Its flowering period typically occurs during the warmer months, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. The plant is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and blooms.
